meanings.definition: To transport or be transported instantaneously from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I wish I could teleport to school instead of taking the bus every morning.
meanings.sent2: The superhero could teleport to different cities in the blink of an eye.
meanings.sent3: If only I could teleport to the fridge for a snack whenever I wanted!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to teleport me back to happier times.
meanings.sent5: The magical ring allowed the wizard to teleport across vast distances.

meanings.definition: The act or process of teleporting.
meanings.sent1: Teleport is a fascinating concept in science fiction movies.
meanings.sent2: The teleport of the spaceship was flawless, impressing the crew.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about a malfunctioning teleport.
meanings.sent4: The teleport of ideas from one mind to another is like a silent dance.
meanings.sent5: The teleport of the magician amazed the audience with its mystery.
